page.title: 18FOOTPATHS IN LITTONDALE
page.content: From Arncliffe paths go over the surrounding fells and also by the River Skirfare, which make pleasant and interesting walks of varying degrees of difficulty. One path leaves from near the church, going down river to Hawkswick; while another goes up-river to Litton. Paths over the moor go from Old Cotes Farm to Starbotton, and from Blea Heads, through Byre Bank Wood over the top to Kettlewell. The path from behind the Falcon Inn goes over Arncliffe Clowder to Malham Tarn and Field Centre, at one point meeting up with the Pennine Way. The paths by the river are gentle walks, but those over the moors are fairly strenuous, and proper walking gear is really necessary. These paths link up with other paths as part of a network of paths covering the Dales.
